Package it.polimi.ingsw.View.User

Class Cli

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.View.User.Cli
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Cli
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
Cli Class contains methods and attributes used to run the user's Cli Interface as a separate Thread.

Attributes:

  • ClientConnection "clientConnection": connection used to send messages to the Server
  • CliController "cliController": contains all methods used to print Information and to ask the Player for an input
  • Client "client": contains information about the Game being played and methods that the Cli needs to work

  • Constructor Details

    • Cli

      public Cli​(Client client, ClientConnection clientConnection)
      Constructor for Cli Class.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Implemented Run method. In consists of a while loop on which the Cli Thread waits for updates made by the UserInteraction of the Client (via the ClientConnection, when it receives messages from the Server).

      While loop is closed when a final message, indicating the Game's End, is received.

      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • actionParser

      public void actionParser​(UIActions ACTION) throws java.lang.Exception
      Parses an UIActions enum into a call to a methods which corresponds to the given action.
      Parameters:
      ACTION - UIActions enum representing what the Cli has to do.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - When an exception is thrown by one of the methods used.

    • displayAction

      public void displayAction() throws java.lang.Exception
      Displays the action done by a Player. If it's a certain Player's turn after the action, the Cli automatically begins a new interaction to make the Player play his turn.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs when calling "actionParser" method.

    • displayError

      public void displayError() throws java.lang.Exception
      Displays an error caused by the action done by a Player. If it's a certain Player's turn after the action, the Cli automatically begins a new interaction to make the Player play his turn.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs when calling "actionParser" method.

    • chooseName

      public void chooseName() throws java.io.IOException
      Asks the player for his name and sends it to the Server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while sending the message.

    • numberOfPlayers

      public void numberOfPlayers() throws java.io.IOException
      Asks the player for the number of players of the game and sends it to the Server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while sending the message.

    • initialLobby

      public void initialLobby() throws java.io.IOException
      Asks the player if he wants to start the game or open the parameter modifier, then sends the player's input to the Server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while sending the message.

    • initialLeaderCards

      public void initialLeaderCards() throws java.io.IOException
      Asks the player to choose his initial Leader Cards and sends chosen Leader Cards to the Server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while sending the message.

    • initialResources

      public void initialResources() throws java.io.IOException
      Asks the player to choose his initial Resources and sends chosen Resources to the Server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while sending the message.

    • turnInteraction

      public void turnInteraction() throws java.io.IOException
      Begins a new turn interaction with the player, where a new Action instance is created and sent to the Server.

      If the MessageToClient read is the same as the previous one sent by the Server, an error is displayed

      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while sending the message.

    • singleplayerTurn

      public void singleplayerTurn() throws java.lang.Exception
      Begins a new turn Singleplayer interaction with the player, where a new Action instance is created and sent to the Server.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs during execution.

    • singleplayerEndWon

      public void singleplayerEndWon()
      Displays a message telling the player he won (in SinglePlayer Mode).

    • singleplayerEndLost

      public void singleplayerEndLost()
      Displays a message telling the player he lost (in SinglePlayer Mode).

    • finalPoints

      public void finalPoints()
      Displays final points of all players and declares the winner.

    • restartOrContinue

      public void restartOrContinue() throws java.io.IOException
      Asks the player if he wants to either start a new game or continue the existing one (Persistence FA).
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while sending a message to the Server.

    • waitReady

      public UIActions waitReady()
      Synchronized with the userInteraction, waits until the UiAction of the latter changes from "WAITING" to something else.

      This method is used with the sole purpose of synchronizing the Cli with messages sent by the Server

      Returns:
      The Action which the player wants to perform.
